creditline: Gift of David Tausig Frank and Kazukuni Sugiyama
description: inside white box with yellow vertical and horizontal lines; inside wooden box with inscriptions; fabric is tan; roller is wood; image of orange colored mountains with trees in white, green, pink and grey; many lines of inscription UL corner
inscription:
林晴啼鳥響　早起出門行　欲汲清渓水　前山受日明 (The wood rains clear, the songs of birds burst forth, / I rise at dawn and set forth out the gate. / I hope to draw the fresh spring water / as the mountain out front catches morning rays.) [Jonathan Chaves]
唯有白雲動　我心歸一聞　超然窮達外　獨坐見空山 {...} (Only the white clouds are moving— / my heart returns to primal peace. / Transcendentally, beyond success and failure, / I sit alone to watch deserted hills.) [Jonathan Chaves]
忽有清機發　吟詩上翠微　夕陽明古逕　松色照寒衣 {...} (Suddenly pure inspiration strikes— / chanting poems I climb the blue green slopes. / Evening sun glows down the ancient path; / pine tree colors illumine my cold robe.) [Jonathan Chaves]
獨徃空山夕　相隨一古琴　水中天上月　雨雨照吾心 {...} (Alone I go up the empty mountain— / evening, and all I bring is my ancient lute. / In stream water, in the sky—two moons, / and this pair now glows within my heart.) [Jonathan Chaves]
初日照門戸　一花高立霜　起来汲寒水　山色遠蒼蒼 {...} (The new sun shines on my gate; / one flower grows there, upright through the frost. / I rise to draw some cold well-water; / mountain colors stretch far away.) [Jonathan Chaves]
我心清不寐　明片在天閒　寂寂虚窓外　秋聲夜動山 {...} (My mind, too clarified for sleep, / the moon appears in heaven. / In the silence outside my empty window / autumn sounds are shaking the mountain tonight.) [Jonathan Chaves]
曲逕通深竹　故人有幽墅　思詩坐雨前　可與青山語 {...} (A winding path leads deep into bamboo / where a friend has a hidden retreat. / Meditating poems we sit as rain comes down; / we can discuss them with these mountains of green.) [Jonathan Chaves]
颯颯空林葉　荒村燈火青　行人不見影　一犬吠寒星 {...} (Soughing, soughing, leaves in the empty wood; / from the deserted village, one lamplight, dim. / The traveler sees not a single shadow; / somewhere a dog barks at the cold stars.) [Jonathan Chaves]
古寺寒燈照　幽人獨坐長　夜深如有鬼　風葉走虚廊 {...} (In the ancient temple, one cold lamp glows; / the hidden one sits alone for hours. / Deep in the night, there seem to be ghosts: / windblown leaves twirling down empty cloisters.) [Jonathan Chaves]
山静雲猶宿　日高門未開　落花幽意動　啼鳥故人来 {...} (…)
客去柴門寂　秋心弄物萃　幽禽啄枯葉　寒日照孤花 {...} (My
markings: poem UR red seal: 師在我 {shi zai ga}; poem LL red seals: [stylized butterfly], 福田世耕 {Fukuda Seikō} [Fukuda Seikō #4], 静處 {seisho} [seisho #4], 无心 {mushin} [mushin #2]; LRC: 拙居 {sekkyo}
signed: 時在戊午秋日寫於拙居并題古道人 {jizai tsuchinoe-uma shūjitsu sha oite sekkyo narabini dai Kodōjin} (The time being an autumn day in 1918, drawn at Residing in Clumsiness and inscription by Kodōjin)
title: One Thousand Mountains and Ten Thousand Streams
